abstract.text: Adopt draggable API to provide items for drag-and-drop operations.

metadata.title: Making a view into a drag source

inlineContent.text: When someone drags an onscreen visual representation of an item in your app, such as a photo,
a Maps location, a Calendar event, or a text selection, the drag operation has some data associated with it,
as well as a preview of the data that the system displays.
modifier to enable the view to function as a drag source,
and provide a value that conforms to the
protocol describes how you can serialize and deserialize your model object for sharing and data transfer.
It provides a transfer representation by composing one or more of the Core Transferable framework’s built-in

To add more transfer representations to a draggable item, specify one or more additional representations in order of preference.
This ensures that the system uses the most suitable representation, depending on the content type that the receiver can accept for drag-and-drop operations.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Enable drag-and-drop interactions in lists, tables and custom views.

abstract.text: The kind for drag and drop previews.
Enable people to move or duplicate items by dragging them from one location to another.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column,
optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
Sets the content shape for this view.
Activates this view as the source of a drag and drop operation.
Activates this view as the source of a drag and drop operation.
Adds a condition for whether the view’s view hierarchy is movable.
A transfer representation for types that participate in Swift’s protocols for encoding and decoding.
A transfer representation that uses another type’s transfer representation as its own.
A declarative description of the process of importing and exporting a transferable item.
A protocol that describes how a type interacts with transport APIs such as drag and drop or copy and paste.
Define a custom representation for your data using a combination of built-in types.

abstract.text: A type that can convert itself into and out of an external representation.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A view that displays an image.
A structure that represents a type of data to load, send, or receive.
